website_summaries.verdict: Long battery life, water resistance and an always-on screen are the best features of the Withings Go, but for its price you can find better overall fitness trackers.
pros: comes with band and clip accessories
easy to use and set up.
cons: no extra watch faces or ways to see health data on the Go screen
can't be set to show the time as the always-on display

customer_reviews.title: Best Tracker Yet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best fitness tracker I've used to date. That includes the Apple Watch, Withings Pulse, several Fitbit models and several Jawbone models. It's simple to use and requires little to no user input. I don't wear it on my wrist so at night I put it on my wrist to track sleep which requires making a change in the app to let it know it's now on the wrist. The E-ink screen is fantastic and simple. The Go is durable almost as simple as set and forget. The one feature it does not have I wish it did is a silent alarm. Overall, fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: I experienced inaccurate step counts
customer_reviews.text: Obviously this is only MY experience, but the Withings Go recorded almost 20% lower total steps vs my wife's Fitbit One and my Iphone over almost a week's time. On one occasion I manually counted 1000 steps, the Go recorded 832 while clipped to my pocket. Too much of a difference in my opinion. Three stars for the simplicity of the device and app design despite the inaccurate step tracking. Again, this is only my experience, but something to keep in mind. The Fitbit One, on the other hand, was usually within 2-3% from my Iphone for daily totals during the week and measured 1011 while manually counting 1000 steps.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: A Versatile Tracker
customer_reviews.text: The Go (now Withings again, after a brief residence with Nokia) is a solid tracker that gives you the option of wearing it on your wrist (where it can take sleep measurements at night) or on a clip which can be attached pretty much anywhere on your clothing. The clip itself is somewhat fragile, so the wristband is the more durable choice. However, Withings customer service is outstanding when it comes to replacing a broken clip. And the Withings platform is the equal of any when it comes to measuring your stats. With scales and a blood pressure monitor on offer, Withings is obviously focused on your health. The Withings Go is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love my Withings Go
customer_reviews.text: I love my Withings Go! I wore a stepper on my pants before this, which I didn't quite prefer and even after wearing it for over a year I would forget to clip it on when I changed clothes. It's helpful that I can wear this like a watch. It is comfortable and light weight! I feel more motivated to reach my step goals. I love the set up with this device. It's very motivating for me to see charts and numbers, and so it is helpful that all of the data is organized that way in the app. I would recommend this product, I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch/tracker for all of a week. It's beautiful, streamlined, light and unobtrusive as well as well made. It did exactly what I wanted in terms of tracking and serving as a functional watch. The app is excellent. The bummer: the second week I wore it it came off of my wrist. The "latch" didn't hold and that was that. Money and tracker gone.
customer_reviews.author: pmisun

customer_reviews.title: Died after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: After my Fitbit died after 18 months of use, I was looking for a cheaper fitness tracker. I liked the price of this, its waterproofness, and the ability to switch it from wrist to pocket (I walk a lot pushing a stroller). It is a bit clunky, and kind of stingy counting steps compared to the Fitbit, and Nokia’s app is much more basic than Fitbit’s, but given the price point, this all seemed reasonable. However, it died after 10 months of use. I thought it was just the battery, but replacing the battery did nothing. I guess my expectations of how long a fitness tracker should last are unrealistic, but 10 months of use doesn’t seem worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Whalen

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Got this thing the day of Halloween, and my weight and activity have gone down and up respectively since then. It helps with a mindfulness on how much you stay still, move, and sleep. Its battery lasted a whole nine months too! But be warned when removing it: it stays in place a bit too well to its back. Currently searching for my back as it fell out upon trying to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie M

customer_reviews.title: Not fancy, but great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older Withings device. The Go is more comfortable on the wrist and actually looks like a watch, which is what I wanted for everyday use. I've used fitbits before, and Withings is as good, plus the flexibility of wearing as a clip or in-pocket is great. I got it on Black Friday sale; it's a good deal at $70, but an absolute steal at $30,
customer_reviews.author: dsbsh

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and pairs well with the free app and the Nokia scale.
customer_reviews.author: C. Abel

customer_reviews.title: It's visually motivating!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my son who is in elementary school, and it works just fine. It gives him a visual of his progress, and it helps motivate him to do more. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 stars, is that the only way to track his progress is if my phone is close by. It would be nice if you could track from the website or some other way.
customer_reviews.author: AFord

customer_reviews.title: Ya get what ya pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap, but not a great tracker. Its fair at tracking walking level, at least in a relative sense, but don't try using this for swimming. Misted up after swimming, but at least it still works.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Durable, inexpensive and fun fitness tracker!
customer_reviews.text: Great device that has never failed me. No need to charge it every day -- I've replaced the $2 battery twice in 14 months. Perfect for swimmers or walkers. Deceptively informative when paired with a smartphone. Affordable and fun. Customer support is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this tracker. I have used several and have found that this one by far is the best. Not at all complicated and does exactly what it says. I can wear it walking, running or swimming and it does an excellent job! Very satisfied with this tracker!
customer_reviews.author: MELINDA ROGERS

customer_reviews.title: This is just what I thought it would be - ...
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I thought it would be - look up tech reviews for specifics, but this is definitely what it was cracked up to be! I wear it all day everyday and am a couple months in with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Anika Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Problems With GO tracking correctly. Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I am having problems with my "Go" not tracking my steps correctly. It may track only 311 total steps for the day while my iPhone tracks 3,290. I have contacted Customer Service repeatedly without getting the problem resolved. They are very slow in responding, returning my e- mails only once a day. My Go has never worked correctly. The sleep tracker works perfectly and I am very happy with that. At this point I am becoming very frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: GMA

customer_reviews.title: Low ball
customer_reviews.text: The device is consistently low on the number of steps compared with two other apps I regularly use
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Has 2 features, but it moves around in the band which takes away 1 feature
customer_reviews.text: The device moves around in the band, which makes the time inaccurate. If it displayed digital time I would still have it. I thought the return policy would be simple and easy but I guess it it not eligible. I am not happy
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Caro

customer_reviews.title: you may be left with a useless piece of hardware that provides metrics which can't be ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase any products from Withings because Nokia Health has crippled not only its integration with HealthKit but also the ability to aggregate data within its own application. Buyer beware, you may be left with a useless piece of hardware that provides metrics which can't be tracked.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Perez II

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This device keeps freezing. It's basically unusable I'm trying to return it but nobody is answering my emails.
customer_reviews.author: Cesco

customer_reviews.title: looked like a toy and was kind of big
customer_reviews.text: Returned it, looked like a toy and was kind of big.
customer_reviews.author: Asia H

customer_reviews.title: hit or miss - miss in my case
customer_reviews.text: doesn't measure accurately, thinks it is in a different time zone, cannot exercise - too bulky on my wrist, cannot do push-ups unless switched around. So bummed :(
customer_reviews.author: NW mom

customer_reviews.title: Tracker itself is ok, but wristband has broken in ...
customer_reviews.text: Tracker itself is ok, but wristband has broken in two months. And there are no possibilities to buy it anywhere. It's not right on my mind to throw out not cheap device by reason of unavailability cheap strap!
customer_reviews.author: Allex

customer_reviews.title: Item does not sync with phone after 3 days
customer_reviews.text: This item only worked for 3 days then won't sync with phone. Tried everything they recommended on the web site. To make thinks worse you can't return it to Amazon. Don't buy it, it's junk.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Seemed to take a bit longer to initially ...
customer_reviews.text: Keep it in my pocket to track steps. Works great. Seemed to take a bit longer to initially pair up to my phone than it should but has worked perfectly since. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clay B

customer_reviews.title: Great design features and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: An excellent device for use by either the neophyte or the veteran exerciser activist great price easy to use highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like my Go
customer_reviews.text: I really like my Go. This step tracker is easy to use with a user friendly app. When the belt clip broke (it's actually very sturdy) Nokia replaced it for free & it was promptly delivered. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Karcher

customer_reviews.title: I do like my withings go
customer_reviews.text: I do like my withings go...i question it's accuracy for sleep but appreciate it's accuracy for swimming. it's pretty simple! Wish it had a heart tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: water proof activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my wife a month ago and she hasn't taken it off.
customer_reviews.author: Pele1952

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My friend wishes she got that instead of fit bit
customer_reviews.author: brenda jean sprague

customer_reviews.title: Never Recharge
customer_reviews.text: Screen visible in bright sun and never recharge to device, what not to like.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Mostly useless
customer_reviews.text: Poor connectivity, ridiculously inaccurate, easily broken. Bought this as a cheaper cute alternative to my 10-year-old's desire for a Fitbit or Apple Watch. The Bluetooth connection worked only once, she could never get data off it. The activity readout varied randomly; no idea what sleep tracking might indicate because it wouldn't connect. Finally, the cheap LCD screen froze into a gray mush after only a few weeks, too faded to make any distinction on its readout, impossible to tell the time. Too bad, she really liked the color.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Sleep Tracker
customer_reviews.text: As a sleep tracker this thing is garbage. Tracks very poorly showing something like 4 hours of sleep per night, losing two plus hours per night. Don't bother with that aspect of this.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Lowe

customer_reviews.title: I regret buying it
customer_reviews.text: This product is to expensive compared to the accuracy and the functions, it counts your steps and that is it. The app does not provide detailed information.
customer_reviews.author: julio.salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Nice Activity Tracker!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife. She loves it for it's simplicity and usefulness. It has great options for wearing it included.
customer_reviews.author: JamesG

customer_reviews.title: Will not sync with android app.
customer_reviews.text: Will not sync with android app on LG G4. Contacted support and was told to get a new phone. Update: Ended up getting a new phone anyway and it will not sync with my Moto G4 either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I received the activity tracker but the package did not ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the activity tracker but the package did not include the gadget that removes the back to replace the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not even if it was in my McDonald's Kid's Meal.
customer_reviews.text: I so disliked this item. It was so flimsy and frankly, there are SO many extremely inexpensive trackers that are SOOOO much better- this was a MISS by Withings.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It definitely keeps accurate count of my steps, plus tracking my steps. I have an apple watch but wasn't sure it was tracking correctly, so I purchased this (as i have their scale and their blood pressure cuff - fabulous products BTW and I love this company). It's light weight, can wear on wrist or put in pocket or use holder to clip to belt or bra, whatever. Very high quality, love it and highly recommend!!! Anyway, loved this so much I bought one for my oldest daughter to use, as well as their scale scale.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Turn it on and Go!
customer_reviews.text: It's simple and it works. Note that I started it up in the USA but then flew to another country and it still was working on USA time so had to restart it again to get it into the right "start time". Makes sense really. I wear this on my waistband to track my steps only - it's simple, discreet, and doesn't replace my favourite watches - but it works well with my Withings Apps. I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: A great activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: I wear this all the time. I like being able to look and see how many steps I have taken and being able to tap it for the time is great. We own several withing products, scale, blood pressure cuff, and another activity tracker. I love the size of it as it is not too large for my petite frame. It's great to be able to track my sleep too. I highly recommend the GO.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Awful Product
customer_reviews.text: Awful! I bought it over a year ago. It had many problems at the beginning. The first time I put new batteries on and froze! I call customer service and because it was over a year old they didn't helped me. They offered me a 25% coupon.
customer_reviews.author: brad k

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy. So Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Big fan of Eink screens so that is a hug plus. After a solid continuous month of use I will say this this device seems to be very accurate and I personal enjoy its simplistic ease of use. Its also very light. I forget i'm wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: J3ffr3yJuic3box

customer_reviews.title: Very unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Well, so far it won’t work. It’s stuck on this little star screen that the app says it should be on but will not connect or install so it’s basically useless. I am currently waiting response from Nokia (they bought Withings out) and we will see if this can be resolved but so far I’m really not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gerrit

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made. Doesn't work and you can't return ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Doesn't work and you can't return it. I would not suggest this to ANYONE!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, bad execution
customer_reviews.text: Garbage... unfortunately. Does not track movement correctly on a treadmill. I tried the clip and the band in many places. Over calculates my steps during normal walking. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of JUNK!!! This is the second item purchased from Withings/Nokia and returned. First I purchased the watch that would not sync and The Go simply did not work at all. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Orlando M

customer_reviews.title: Straightforward and accurate enough
customer_reviews.text: No bother to wear, doesn't trigger metal sensitivities and performs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Suemo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these 1is not working anymore! 1 needs a battery i can't find to replace it!!! 1 is going dead.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great Father's day gift
customer_reviews.text: My dad likes it, I bought it for him for Father's day.
customer_reviews.author: Hakarune

customer_reviews.title: IT HAS PROVEN TO BE AN EXCELLENT TRACKER, EASY TO USE AND ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: I LOOKED AT MANY ACTIVITY TRACKERS BEFORE DECIDING ON THE WITHINGS GO. IT HAS PROVEN TO BE AN EXCELLENT TRACKER, EASY TO USE AND ACCURATE.
customer_reviews.author: PSB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't track anything. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't track activity or sleep; the app told me I had to purchase the Aura to track sleep. Contacted support, performed factory reset, still didn't work. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Outten

customer_reviews.title: ... I have two other Withings products and they are great. (The scales and blood pressure monitor) The readings ...
customer_reviews.text: To start I have two other Withings products and they are great. (The scales and blood pressure monitor) The readings go straight to your phone. I have had a Fitbit and enjoyed it so I was very excited when Withings had the Go. The swimming feature and the price helped also. The swim feature worked well. The sleep feature did not. It kept saying I took a nap when I did not. I went to a movie and it thought I was taking a nap. The step feature was always much less than my phone showed. With all of that said I believe Withings will figure out the bugs and make the changes necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: BEST VALUE - BEST PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE the Go! Simple, dependable, versatile and accurate. Like being able to tell time with a push of the dial - the main reason I purchased it. Also appreciate not having to charge it!!!! The watch battery is genius! All of the above AND it's waterproof - great for swimming. I have been telling everyone how pleased I am with this. Buy one - you won't be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Gail E. Morin

customer_reviews.title: fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it's waterproof. I broke a couple of the Withings Pulse O2 after getting it wet.
customer_reviews.author: cpascu01

product_meta.title: Withings Go
feature_bullets: Sorry, Withings no longer provides support, updates or repairs for this product. Please visit our website for the latest product launches and news.
